0KRDaFaaQs5P-UuOCJ_eRA.text: The food was brilliant and very cheap!I won't give it 5 stars though because the guy who took my order on the phone seemed to be new and was very very slow at taking my order.

3ojTmd1zPnK5n8i-KvNKMw.text: What a marvelous find!  I am not a huuuge fan of Indian food, but now and again I'll have a sit and give it a shot.  A friend and I are traveling through Europe and staying at a hostel.  The hostel receptionist guy suggested Simply Indian when my friend asked of his favorite restaurant of that cuisine.It was an easy find from where we were, just a five minute hop scotch, skip and jump away actually.The atmosphere was quite cozy, seating about maybe 15 people total in the restaurant, if that! Pear juice - Delish!Lassi - Divine!Lamb soup - My friend said it was the best!Aloo gobi - To die for!Cheese naanand Garlic naan - Mouthwatering...Remembering exactly what you ordered six weeks after eating it?  - Priceless!Visit Simply Indian for a simply enjoyable meal

QNp4tyZk09hM-vUIsPouFw.text: I think Simply Indian's name is a little bit misleading -- there's nothing simple about their food at all, and that's the fun in it.This restaurant is tucked away near the Borough Tube Station, but boasts a nice selection of dishes that offer something more than the run-of-the-mill Chicken korma/tikka masala that most Indian restaurants in this country tend to rely on. Those dishes are available, of course, but for the same money, there's much better and unique dishes to try.When I was there, my boyfriend tried the Masala Dosa -- a large crispy pancake served with four different types of fillings that was different to anything I've ever had. I had the Tandoori Fish Tikka, which included a really delicate curry and very well cooked halibut -- my only complaint was that there wasn't more of it. Another person in our dinner party had the lamb shank, which was both tender and juicy. Everyone came out of their Simply Indian experience with happy stomachs and much of our conversation revolved around what we would order when (and not if) we came back for another round.Also, something I appreciated was the size and quantity of the mango lassi I ordered. Most restaurants that I've been to tend to skimp out and give wimpy portions of mango lassi that go away too quickly. Simply Indian's was not only tasty, but plentiful.And for a final comment, I'd also like to note that Simply Indian is very affordable, so try it out!

xnQedOqY5YJSCVbIl-Szcg.text: The food was nice, although it was small portions. The staff didn't seem that welcoming. To be honest then I don't think the food was worth the price asking. The indian food served at 'hare krishna' restaurants around London is much nicer and cheaper. The eating experience was compared to them somewhat disappointing.

TXGokZTeGwxRrZf7vcpXSg.text: This is a very small (hole in the wall) restaurant. But thats totally fine as long as the food is good. For starters we had poppadums with delicious chutneys. We ordered the Hyderabadi Kali Mirch and Sindhi Murgh for entree it was pretty good i must say. Hyderabadi kali mirch was a bit on the spicy side but full of flavour, sindhi murgh was creamy and delicious. To finish off our spicy dinner we had Tropical tutti frutti cocktail icecream for dessert which ended up as a pleasant palette cleanser. Service was good. So overall i would indeed recommend this place. Totally worth a try.

yfgkhh-Ck3AIUg46yxxVFg.text: Bit of a good find. Doesn't look amazing from outside, but food was great. Service could be friendlier but you can forgive that when you're paying a low price for a great quality meal. BYOB so pop round the corner to the supermarket for a couple of bottles of wine first.

61KICWOh_vjgsZ0naMYeNA.text: Wonderful place. Lots of going on inside, food is delicious and staff is well-trained. I like it. There are some things that need a renovation but that's all.

ukZjVdOSaIpM734bxkHbqw.text: Been living in the area a while and knew this place existed, but with friends from Sweden wanting a curry decided to try this place out. Fairly modern place and very clean. The waiters were very helpful with a pushchair, and a high chair arrived for our small diner. Service was prompt and the food delish. I had the wrap for a starter and though not very Indian, it was fresh, big and tasty. For mains curries were ordered along with the mixed grill and the dosa, which was fab. We didn't order sweets, but the food was excellent value and the BYO great. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone local and we'll deffo be back.

qvgal68X_fvhZrV24QYkNA.text: Good Value for Borough, Friendly atmosphere and good value for a lunchtime meal, tasty :)

oY1ELXwU9k5JP3eaTnIUOg.text: The restaurant looks very cozy and comfortable inside. The tables are nice and far enough from each other so you can have a nice conversation with your party. The food is great and I've also tried their delivery system which was fast enough to not let me hanging hungry.

-R9p5AzH3EVR40zS3-YnuA.text: This place is on the lower floor of my apartment building.  I walked by it a bunch of times and the smells coming from this place are always outstanding.  I stopped in on a Friday right around 6 when the kitchen opened back up and got a to go order.I had the coconut rice, nann bread and lamb madras (sp?).  The lamb was not "on the menu" but the guy who took my order recommended it when I said I wanted something HOT.  It was definately HOT and had great flavor.  The rice was also delicious and had little chunks of pineapple and coconut throughout.  Next time I'll order more bread to mop up the curry.  Also, as a bonus, this lasted me for 2 whole meals, and for only 10 quid.  Rock and roll affordable, delicious Indian restaurant.

B-mQDrbP9VK1jHrp_5Ha-Q.text: I have eaten curry all my life.Not only is this the best curry I have ever had, I honestly think it may be the best meal I've ever had...

Zs4dGYmPGvl3m18sgf6gMg.text: Pros and cons to this place. Ordered a take away so can't make any comment on the service or ambience of the restaurant although I have walked pask a few times and it looks very cosy inside. Pro, the food was lovely, not one of those places that supplies meat lumps in gloopy sauces of varying shades of luminous orange. The dishes were fragrant and you could taste the different spices, not overwhelmingly hot either. Con, the dish sizes were quite small, we ordered quite generously for three people and polished it off far too easily. Pro, you won't feel like a big fat jabba after you've stuffed yourself rotten on giant portions. Con, isn't that what ordering an Indian take away is all about?!??

ESu88JzZbWs25cJyK5OuJw.text: Simply Indian has really good food. Everything my friends and I had there has always been flavorful with just the right amount of heat. It's no wonder we go always go back. Mango lassis are nice and thick, chicken chaat is great wih all the fresh herbs they put in, the naan is to die for, and moglai paneer kofta is amazing. They also have a 5 pound lunch buffet that's a good deal.

wLYSU7YGXKceWMNxhZY90Q.text: Quite expensive but quite good value for SE1. a great local curry house for take aways. You can order online which is really easy and the delivery is quick. We had vege dishes which tasted good. a wide choice on the menu and would recommend to anyone else in the area.

6YQcBLmBx6_gXVIF3R1QtA.text: Service was poor, it took nearly half an hour  to get the check and they forgot several drink orders. The homemade chutney was delicious but mail main dish was bland. It was cheap so it we got what we paid for. It was worth the money that we spent but I would probably not come back

tGPsQX1YXEXo-zNL3RPbFw.text: Lovely Indian restaurant in a quiet street around Borough. Amazing food and service. You can bring your own drinks and they don't charge you extra which is great. We ordered starters two mains with naan and rice all for 30 pounds for two. The food is really good we had some samosas, chickpeas salad and for mains chicken and lentils. Overall very good, 4 stars because the starters are very small for the price but otherwise recommended!

XTOuQsnTOPFxnoGVRnE5KQ.text: There is a nice relaxed atmosphere and very yummy food. The staff are extremely nice and helpful. It is also open till 11 which is very nice.The Gajjara was simply amazing and the ice cream was a delight to eat.

XkgjE4tLVobqpYPe4ASKvQ.text: I went here while I was staying in London for a few weeks on business, and this place was literally downstairs from the apartment I was staying at.  It's a small hole-in-the-wall joint, but their lamb shank was probably one of the best I've ever had.  In all fairness, I don't think I've ever had a lamb shank at an Indian restaurant before so take this review with a grain of salt.In addition to the lamb shank, I also had the biryani, mushroom masala, and garlic naan.  All of it tasted better than the stuff I typically get back in the states.

85mSBwWofxWpqKMVXFUdwg.text: Amazing service.  Waiter was very courteous and responsive to our needs. I was a bit dehydrated and drank a lot of water. I don't think my glass of water was ever empty for more than a minute.  Food was also delicious, we tried a variety of the lamb dishes and loved them.

qh0-dwRxxAw8SjTlpwsqag.text: nice restaurant! clean environment and fresh ingredient. Love it! if i could live in London, i would come here frequently.

c3cf6GTcfgUrnAs3qWpwTw.text: My wife and I absolutely loved this place. It's a gem. Service was great and food was delicious. I would highly recommend if you are in the mood for Indian. Making a reservation seems to be recommended. We walked in right at opening and the server accommodated us but needed the table back in an hour for future guests. Overall the 5 star review came down to tremendous food quality.

kuRf-_kIL_LS7Vs2804mmQ.text: Simply Indian is an intimate space serving delicious, flavorful food.  Service was excellent.  Highly recommended.

MAqn1B33Niej2CEIr0RpNg.text: Can't believe I've never been here before... really interesting menu, great value and service. I'll be back asap!

Tx_rrOr-DIyi9zhmjGHhqA.text: Amazing Indian place and the only decent diner you can find in Dover St that open till 12!

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom

oV_wAVJnqCh6QqquG9SK3A.text: I really love eating here. It's a tiny restaurant near Borough station and you can bring your own alcohol. I normally order a tapas selection, the Chloe Kosta Roti, Paneer Kofta, Chicken Malai, just lots of different dishes to share which makes it different from other Indians that I go to. The food is really fresh and authentic and the place feels homely and cosy.I would really recommend going here and ordering something different.

zv_zC-iKlKVwnsnZbHZ3uQ.text: The food at this place is ok, but beware... there are hidden costs with dining at this restaurant. Our waiter charged us extra per sauce PER PERSON. He also asked if we preferred rice or naan, which we assumed was included in our main dish and apparently wasn't. Overall, spent an extra £8 more than we expected to. Needless to say, we were very surprised when our bill arrived!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

p-BelkhgPUXtXEEbkk6DXA.text: Sitting down for a group booking, I was pretty excited to try this place as one of the birthday boy's friends said he had stopped looking for good nearby Indian food after he found this place.You know if a review starts with a subordinate clause, things can only go down hill.The staff were cheerful and chatty with me. It had been preciously arranged for a £20 a head buffet and it was fine if I ordered from a la carte since only a couple of buffet dishes were vegan out of 10 or so.We had obligatory poppadoms and the chutneys were pretty good actually (it better be as it ended up each one was pushing £2!).The staff knew I was dairy-free gave me extra mango chutney in lieu of raita (yay!), but still brought out creamy sides dishes as extras for me, and I'm pretty sure the dosa still had ghee in it (boo!). The food was ok. Nothing special. Nothing terrible though. A mere "it was good" happily wafted about the table.The bill came. It was £22pp (instead of £20). Well, this mistake was remedied by NOT going to the agreed price and ADDING an additional person onto the bill. Who, all of a sudden, they had prepared extra buffet food for and would not back down. Did I mention the 6 poppadoms they brought to share between 11 people was £10?!So, as other reviews have mentioned, DON'T go with groups. The only reason I didn't give it one star because the food itself wasn't terrible. Everything else was: service, price, toilets through kitchen, and getting some weird bites on my fingers while I was there (dirty napkins?).

8Q8tLTI8D6lmyqOP6yykkQ.text: Phenomenally good. Prepared on the spot, super fresh, absolutely satisfying - and without the greasy weight that is the downfall of so many Indian joints. The flavors are bold and distinct, but with enough restraint to let you appreciate each on its own and in combination with the others. A real symphony of a meal - and what a value! Will definitely be returning, and often. A real find!

s3DFr8w78eKG3zuDp3hrrg.text: Great find! Off the beaten path a bit, but a convenient walk from the hotel. Reasonable prices for some good Indian food ranging the gamut from he generic to the exotic. Chicken tikka masala was dry and not terribly flavorful, but the daal made up for it. Lamb kabobs were incredibly juicy and moist. The server was friendly and helpful with suggestions.

OOuutVLjR8vijt_99NDdoQ.text: Lamb shank is the one of the best food provided there! I go to this restaurant at least once a week

qjl8olSd88rOcIwwfh5wmA.text: An infusion of taste! And the place was really clean with a nice twist to the presentation of food. Highly recommended!

DHFq0C78GLFvck__qk2BvA.text: Small but lovely authentic Indian restaurant. Located close to where we are staying and we noticed many people ordering take away. Food was delicious and wait staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate vegetarian options, of which there were many, and were very pleased. We'll be back during our stay.

TXemfIYx5B586m9Ckpk5RQ.text: Tucked away on Tabard St., Simply Indian has limited seating (including a few small tables outside) but quite an extensive menu. Along with typical Indian appetizers like samosas and papadums (served with 4 dips & a small chickpea mango salad), there is a wide selection of both vegetarian and meat curries, with various degrees of heat. If you're a fan of naan bread, I highly recommend trying out the less traditional variations. They also make a mean mango lassi here. My only criticism is that service can be rather slow, even when it's not busy so be patient. The food comes out quickly but the waiters tend to disappear out back. Like most indian restaurants in the UK, Simply Indian is BYOB though I'm not sure if there's a corking fee.

skNJtYSo2m4udm4WoNVMmQ.text: Oh dear.The delivery driver didn't speak English and got lost on the way to my well-known building. He called me and just said "Where to come" over and over and over again.Worse still, the food, while professionally and impressively packaged, was not appealing. The meat was a bit sketchy, and every single bite of naan had something gritty in it, like sand.I'll give this one a pass.The search for good delivered Indian food in SE1 continues.

eiFio1_Lkg34PlGeLlHmNQ.text: Authentic Indian cuisine with great portions and prices! The service was good -- they even took our coats. I would 100% recommend eating here to locals and tourists of London alike.

2evEfHqg06PWMMn3_NeG5A.text: Little place with big taste.  From the first bite you can tell how fresh the ingredients are in their food.  The menu has a large variety of great food.  The chai, Chana masala, biryanis and papadum were wonderful.

d8yUihN18rHCaLCJrzH-_w.text: Although the menu has changed, the food was still incredible.  Everything we tried was great and still a bargain.  We brought our own drink and the service was very friendly.  We highly recommend!

NbB-4F_ZhKMYco7APCzHyQ.text: My friend and I walked in around 11:10pm thinking we wouldn't get served, but they were so welcoming and allowed us to stay and eat. We had the most amazing food, the nan was to die for and the spinach and mushroom salad was heavenly. The food was so light and fresh, unlike some other Indian food I have had in the past, and the flavors were so delicate. As a vegan, I was extremely impressed with their variety of vegan and vegetarian options. Abu, our server was so nice and attentive. I will definitely be going back.

NFji6zCsMPl3IBhbRn9utw.text: I recently had the privilege of eating at this little restaurant on the recommendation of a friend who lives in the area; I am pleased to say it did no disappoint. The restaurant was clean and the service very good. Everything I we ordered was delicious. The food was freshly cooked and  I especially liked that the food was not laden with oil. Even thought he restaurant is very small, it was a great experience. The food was yummy, the service was great and the price was good. Abu (the owner I think) was especially nice, taking the time to come out and check that everything was satisfactory, which it was; it's always nice to meet the owners of establishments - he clearly was passionate about providing a great dining experience. I would highly recommend this place without reservation.

N0vFxh2x1FjmhRdJiY90gA.text: Small, quiet but delicious ! I tried a lot of Indian restaurants in London and this is one of the best.

LDs3-rFjSzLpRf_dd7fFYw.text: Great secret spot in a hidden street! Comprehensive menu without an overwhelming number of options, everything is freshly made, tasty and comes in good portions, and is very reasonably priced. Some really delicious stuff like the duck or goat curry. Very clean and quiet room with a friendly and attentive staff. This is one of our neighborhood canteens where we always love to come!

1wZsVXrVl2703FsmAEMxaQ.text: Food was good but terrible service and refused to accept the yelp coupon as shown despite it still being on yelp! Shame since the food was so good, wont come back due to the poor service and refusal to honor discounts adverised

wAuKnoonzrIrKKeogLtW8Q.text: Fantastic first experience! Alum served us amazing Samosas and Chati before our delicious South Indian Thali and Tharavu Duck. Quaint little place with only a handful of intimate tables, great little local spot that is all about the food!

qv83mwkq4-44wpKcf7bYmA.text: Found this place on Yelp and could not ask for a better meal after coming off a flight. We stayed at Travelodge Southwark and this was just a walking distance from it. The service is very good and friendly here while the food really speaks wonders. Their curries are a bit different, lovely fresh herbs and spices, not overly heavy. I went for the Goan chicken curry which was absolutelty delicious.  A nice spicy kick to it too. We also tried their shank of lamb which was so tender it came off the bone just like that. To top it off the marinade and sauce was divine.  We thought the prices were reasonable too. This place is definitely a gem! Huge plus that they opened late. We just saw someone walk in at 10pm for a table.

JahfgbZRwxlfvlqz6uhUMw.text: I tried several Indian restaurants in London during my recent trip and have to admit this by far is the best.  The food is authentic and has a home made taste.  It is a very small restaurant, so make sure you have a reservation.

z0CoADrPttADe057ovoefQ.text: Don't judge a book by its cover! This place looks like a hole in the wall but the food is some of the best Indian in the area. Not greasy at all- great flavor and great service. We were staying near by during a recent visit to London and ordered takeout 3 times from this place- you won't be disappointed!

FKy7bKPeuvN9D71SNDzGbw.text: Small but cozy restaurant, 6 pounds for a very decent lunch is a very nice choice in a rainy day. Highly recommend for the price & quality.

bYloQNhry5xCNui3BMc7Sw.text: This is such a gem! What a terrific Indian joint located in my neighborhood. This is the best Indian I have had in London at an excellent value. The staff is sharp and helpful. One of the best parts is the BYOB policy. Cannot beat SI. Take your next in-town guests here!

ZKyg-PKbuWvtuKZsgirLTQ.text: Simply top notch! This cozy spot is nestled steps away from Borough Station. Unbelievable flavours, quite a variety of options and good portions. You will be hard pressed to find this quality of Indian food for the very reasonable prices. Overall some of the best Indian food I've had around the world! For two people we ate (and had leftovers to take with us):Keralan prawnsTandoori tangri chickenPunjabi bhindi (okra) - as a side Smoked aubergine - as a side Potato and dal - as a sideTomato chili rice Basmati rice Chapati I recommend any and all of the above options!

weNgmxdvw7X9M1kn0eSLVw.text: Thali surprise with great service. If you need a beer then walk across the road for a proper pint at the pub then come back with it. No nonsense genuine cuisine.

Lu2GR0WOpH5jcl9Eg5xvnA.text: Very good Indian food. Tasty and right sized portions. Small place. So you will have to fit in close to other tables. I would definitely recommend this place

nvQrNJXqVc7LgHSYzP5pFg.text: Delicious food at a reasonable price for a decent size amount. The restaurant is clean and cozy with simple décor. You will be able to hear everyone's conversation if you wish.  The waiters are very nice and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Take away, why because it was so good I wanted more!

7MAUnQAUR_0USBGi75Ev-g.text: This restaurant is remarkably close to Great Dover Street apartments,  a college dorm of KCL - maybe only a five minute walk.  We got the kashmir lamb rogan,  which was recommended to us, and a traditional chicken tikka masala. The Naan is hot and relatively thin and crispy.Overall a good deal. Would come back again.

Pk_XH0-g1LgDoES955eF-Q.text: I am not a big fan of Indian food but my boyfriend insisted so I tried Simply Indian and was extremely satisfied. The waiter was so patient and helpful, he explained the menu items and recommended the Goan chicken which I loved. Chat appetizer is a must! Clean, professional, and relaxing environment . Simply Indian definitely opened my taste buds to Indian food!

6N_T6sGXXcrY4MDJT0cu8Q.text: ""Delicous food, Wonderful service, reasonable price""Visit here numerous time in a week. Fantastic place. Great menu. Amazing delicious food. Beautiful cooked and presented meal. very reasonable price compare all other restaurant. Very good and attentive service. Packed even on a week night so definitely need to book. Great as a treat though. Most of the meals were the best Indian food we had ever had.I am looking forward to visit this restaurant again on next week.

rgMqXAQt6JqD2zRIAVTK8Q.text: I used to go to this restaurant and order from them very often, the food is delicious, but the service is simply appalling.I ordered food for 12:30, the order was half an hour late when I called about it, and a member of staff said it was still going to be another 40minutes, with no apology. He said he would call me back. I missed his call and called him back right away, and all he said was that the order was on its way and that he couldn't tell me how long it would take. When I complained about this, especially the part when no one had even apologised to me for the food being ONE HOUR late at this point, he started screaming at me, said I didn't let him check on the food's arrival time because I called too soon (despite me being the one to return his call), and then hung up on me.When I spoke to the manager, he behaved in a similar way, refusing to apologise for the lateness OR the rude member of staff, and when I tried to finish my sentence he said I wouldn't let him speak, WHILE HE WAS INTERRUPTING ME. Mind numbing. He also lied and said the staff member was yelling because he was on the road, then I clarified it wasn't the driver, and then he lied again and denied he had yelled at all! This is also the second time this has happened to me, there is a member of staff there that if your food is extremely late, will start calling you an "impossible woman" (what he did last time) if you dare to politely ask for  an apology. Sexist on top of rude, because God forbid a woman has a problem with him and wants to be heard. That was a couple years ago and back then I was assured he was let go. Apparently not only wasn't he, but the management backs this behaviour.DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS.

Z-tIPoHP3P7jWJitZTillQ.text: I came here after Colombian lost to England in the Word Cup. It was late and they were one of a few Indian places still open. The spot is small with limited seated but they had some nice jazz playing. The waiter was very attentive. The food came quick and was very tasty, flavorful and plentiful. I'm in town for two weeks and I plan to return.

-0wHowFGfA0ovmzhV4xavg.text: My friends and I stopped by Simply Indian on vacation after hearing great things about the Indian food on offer in London. We were seated quickly upon entering the establishment, but the table next to us was filled with drunk, extremely loud patrons, at least ten or twelve. Their table was filled with empty bottles of booze and they were yelling, singing, and blasting music out of a shitty Bluetooth speaker placed on the table. By far the worst restaurant patrons I've ever seen anywhere. It's not SI's fault at all, but I really need to vent after such a shocking display of contempt for others. Luckily they left afer about fifteen minutes, but it was a painful time while it lasted.Anyway. We quickly got our papadum after sitting down and it, and especially the sauces with which it was served, were amazing. The salsa (whose name I do not know) was phenomenal, and the chutney was better than any other I've ever had. But once receiving it, we were left hanging for a good ten or fifteen minutes before our orders were taken. We were considering leaving, but our food came out only five minutes later, and it was well worth the wait. I got chicken biryani, probably my favorite Indian dish, and it beat even the delicious biryani found in my local Indian place back home.A friend got the Southern Thali and I think he won the night. The assortment of food that came with it was broad, and all of it was yummy. A little spicier than I was prepared for, but it was overall well-balanced and left me wanting a portion of my own.The table also got some jhalfrezi. I'd never heard of the dish before, but the description sounded appetizing so we took a chance and, lo and behold, it was wonderful. Again, spicier than I was expecting, but it was something fundamentally different than Indian food I was familiar with. I've never noticed it on any menu before, but I'll be sure to look for it when I get back home!We were surprised with a dessert menu and, at a friend's strong suggestion, got the carrot fudge with mango ice cream. Fantastic decision. At risk of sounding repetitive, it was something totally new to me and borderline indescribable. It tasted carrot-like, but smoother and sweeter. I'll echo that recommendation. Just get it. Our waiter actually brought one out without even taking our order, he was that sure we'd like it!Afterwards, he came out again and had a chat about the chef's background and the philosophy of the food he had prepared for us.Overall, despite the rocky start to the night, the food and service were phenomenal. It's sort of hidden in a back corner, but if you find yourself in the neighborhood, Simple Indian is absolutely worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Mango and Savory Lassi
Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Biryani

M398fy7rwt_TTA8C6pxpPw.text: Under pressure from the owner, I was asked to leave a review. Normally I refuse to leave a negative review like this, but since he insisted, I suppose I must. I always like to start with 5 stars. But this place... ugh! -1 for ambience and terrible seating. The chairs were old and felt like we might fall through. The old music didn't match the Indian theme. And the lighting is awful! -1 for the waiter who had no idea what was on the menu or anything about it. -1 for the aggressive owner who thrust his card with TripAdvisor, Yelp, and Facebook and insisted we give him a good review. -1 for the owner offering 10 percent off your bill through yelp for checking in. But when we went to use it he asked "Did you leave a review??" When I answered Yes, he demanded to see my phone and read the review.  It was very confrontational. -1 for not giving us the 10 percent off after we had to ask for it again. Giving us 5% off and thinking we wouldn't check his math. Sadly, there isn't a 0 stars. I wanted to like this place. We walked for 45 minutes to get there. But I just couldn't. The food wasn't that great.

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom

YOG2CJgxoVkZ8II9JLV9mg.text: Stumbled across this lovely Indian whilst visiting alex monroe handmade jewellery shop. This Indian was equally handmade, unique recipes and great atmosphere.  From Manchester (Burnley actually!) but might visit for lunch again tomorrow... why the heck not???

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. En route!

_2ZBrW3vq62o-TSsOGjERQ.text: Incredible food. Had a slightly different take on the typical dishes which was very impressive to me. Taste was on point! If you are in London and looking for some great Indian food this place is a must.

OhrcBM9Gr0HOJOpCMrEwzA.text: I've been to Kerala, Chennai, Delhi and many other places in India. I KNOW South Indian food even though I prefer North Indian, but this South Indian food made me want to reverse that preference. This food was "simply Indian." It was Indian made just RIGHT, with fresh, elegant ingredients and rich spices. The spice was just what I expect from South Indian food, decadently spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Shots from the Kerala rail system

zc11rJ_q_m07Rq1GWGaHNA.text: This is a tiny spot, off the beaten path.  You'll be glad you went the extra steps to get there. Food was good across the board.  The eggplant (aubergine) was incredible.  Smoky with incredible garlic flavor.  One of the best things I've eaten in a long time.  Fish curry was light and fresh. Dal was memorable.  Highly recommend finding this hidden gem.

njLBpUYzgFwohUP1WP1c4Q.text: This place is SIMPLY amazing. If you're looking for a new place to try or are craving Indian, go here! Go here now!!! I've travelled to different parts of India and this is by far one of the more authentic places I've been to. The foods are definitely more "home-y" oriented. If you want a taste of India -- come here!!

HHSGhhPSs7GSX8hRKAmAEg.text: Delicious food and fast service after I came close to midnight. The waiter was very encouraging about trying certain dishes and I am glad I followed his advice. Im by no means an expert on Indian but the food here is exceptionally good. Perfectly sized portions, not greasy, very flavorful. You cant go wrong herex

4GEsAV72fMQf1i4yKMm3fQ.text: We found the waiter to be very confrontational and rude. He failed to explain the restaurants policy where everyone had to order a main course.  We ordered a bunch of items. Other than the biryani, no other dish was good. The curry dishes seemed watered down and lacked flavor.

YPKlrLTqTHqneQ4J6wp4wQ.text: It's off a Major street in Southwark London but definitely worth the detour.  My wife and I were impressed with the food and atmosphere.  This is a peaceful romantic kind of setting - not great for children.  We thought the Okra fries were special and the homemade cinnamon ice cream.  My chicken jalfrezzi dish was great.  If I lived in London I think I would be a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Mint and rose tea pot - lovely
Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Okra fries - tasted excellent
Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Gourmet cinnamon and salted caramel ice creams

ap4tFJNrzC3ss468F36sgw.text: I guess Ling T. saw us walk in at 22 hours or the couple after us. Either way, there was a large group of soccer players about 19-24 being overly loud, chaotic, unruly and loud again while drinking in the corner of the restaurant. I'm amazed the table top that was on date night didn't leave sooner. Either way the dishes and prices were more than enough for me to note:1) It's worth returning 2) The new menu's are needed3) liquor is BYOB4) The Mix grill was done quite nicely5) I tried new things and although I won't order the top left chicken dish again - there was nothing wrong with it but more heat than needed. I'm from Louisiana which includes New Orleans and all the creole/cajun and deep south spiciness any one can handle YET... I don't like spice for the sake of heat. This could have been just as good a few notches down on the scale of measuring heat/spice. 6) the samosa dip was nice. Sweet and Spicy - just right. 7) The onions on the mix grill were excellent. 8) Yelp 10% off check in offer hit the right spot 9) Location is nice as it's close enough to the Tower10) The place is small as in tight on space but clean. The restroom was spotless11) No ice12) Naan even with lamb was great13) You must order an entree if you're ordering. 14) Krysten P wrote her review as directed in exchange for the 10% off. IT's hiliarious as one friend stated...that's not how this is supposed to work. I didn't mind as I liked the place 15) Late hours16) The buffet used to exist, lunch buffet once existed, lower prices were an old time staple and currently - you can get all but a few dishes for $10.17) Pizza place next door is quite nice. And a good price for take away.

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Blackouts everywhere.

pX0GdHtIwPV-U07nyz1JKw.text: Good service and food is delicious. Thank you. Hope there is more Indian food that tastes this good in L.A. 4-5 stars. good for lunch.

dv5lwNp8yItW28mLfBlxHg.text: Cozy decor, helpful staff and delicately balanced cuisine.Ordered the Hyderabadi Kali Mirch chicken, Kashmiri Lamb Rogan, garlic naan and Bombay chai tea. Each was distinctive and flavorful. The chai had a nice pronounced spice to it; it cut the rich sauces nicely. Very reasonably priced too. This was a promising introduction to Indian cuisine in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Simply Indian - London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan, Kashmiri Lamb Rogan and Hyderabadi Kali Mirch

3Hnar5bedM-Rb1bPLJ7zRw.text: We wouldn't have found this place without the internet since it is on a side street, but we are really glad we did. The service was very good and all of our food was really tasty. The okra fries were a pleasant surprise and I thought the Kerala Prawn was wonderful- a little spicy for my wife but just right for me. We also had lemon rice and smoked aubergine which were very good.  The Kozhi chicken was good but not outstanding.If we lived in this area I think we would be regulars.

lZUubIP3yrIy1a1l9cRR1A.text: The new menu is amazing! We had date night dinner for two and even though this place is off the main road it's definitely worth the walk. Super fast service and everything was cooked perfectly.

tLS_BzoSw9huRL6WD-XwkA.text: What a wonderful discovery!  The food here is fresh and delicious, some of the best Indian food that I've had in a long, long time.  While everything was good, they definitely have the best mango lassi I've ever had anywhere.  Pricing was average, at 48 GBP for lunch for three.

ydh5V5ZmECvAoMCOGUjTBA.text: First urgent pressing question I have:WHERE CAN I GET THIS AMAZING FOOD IN THE STATES?My little sister had the old-style Delhi makhani, and I had the family style goat kari. Both were perfect eat in portions and seasoned incredibly well. The staff was kind and accommodating and gladly explained how the menu had recently been revamped and improved. I love the style of papadum they serve here--very light and crunchy with great accompaniments (the chutney is light and fresh with bright lemon tang).Only downside is now I have to go back home and try to find a restaurant like this one! I have a mission!
